disconnected.title: portraits - disconnected
disconnected.inspirations: Deana Lawson, Imogen Cunningham, Baldwin Lee, Mark Steinmetz
disconnected.text:
For this project, we were tasked with capturing eight unique portraits, each featuring a different individual. The focus was on composition, lighting, and expression to create engaging and visually compelling images.

- 8 photos of 8 unique people

This project was an exploration of portrait photography, emphasizing how lighting, angles, and subject positioning can convey personality and emotion. My goal with this collection was to portray the general disconnection of society today. Each photo features a subject who is disconnected in some wayâ€”whether from a loved one, reality, their emotions, school, or something else. The physical representation of this disconnection is the presence of headphones, which audibly detach the subject from reality, adding another layer to the theme.

shadow-and-light.title: shadow and light
shadow-and-light.inspirations: Philip-Lorca diCorcia, Rose Marie Cromwell, Roy DeCarava
shadow-and-light.text:
For this project, we were tasked with capturing ten photographs that explore the contrast between light and shadow as primary compositional elements. The specific requirements included:

- 5 photos where the main subject is shadow

- 5 photos where the main subject is light

This project was an exercise in understanding contrast, mood, and composition through the interplay of light and dark. Rather than simply capturing objects, the goal was to highlight the dramatic effects that shadows and illumination can create in a frame

still-life.title: still life
still-life.inspirations: Jan Groover, David Alekhuogie, Laura Letinsky
still-life.text:
For this project, we were challenged to capture six still life photographs, exploring both natural and arrange compositions. The requirements included:

- 3 photos of natural still life

- 3 photos of unnatural still life

This project focused on composition, lighting, and storytelling through still life photography. The goal was to observe and capture everyday objects in their natural state while also experimenting with deliberate arrangements to create visually compelling scenes.

aperture-and-shutter-speed.title: aperture & shutter speed
aperture-and-shutter-speed.text:
For this project, we were challenged to capture six still life photographs, exploring both natural and arrange compositions. The requirements included:

- 3 photos of natural still life

- 3 photos of unnatural still life

This project focused on composition, lighting, and storytelling through still life photography. The goal was to observe and capture everyday objects in their natural state while also experimenting with deliberate arrangements to create visually compelling scenes.

self-portraits.title: self portraits
self-portraits.inspirations: Deana Lawson, Imogen Cunningham, Baldwin Lee, Mark Steinmetz
self-portraits.text:
For this project, we were tasked with capturing a series of eight self-portraits, each connected by a unifying theme. The focus was on composition, expression, and storytelling to create a cohesive and meaningful collection.

- 8 self-portraits with a connected theme

My goal with this collection was to showcase how running has taken over my life and is woven into everything I do. Each portrait reflects this theme, illustrating the ways in which running influences my daily routines and overall existence. Whether through physical exhaustion, doing running-related things while not running, or fed up with the grind, these images represent the connection between myself and the sport.
